channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Council housing rubbish flowing on to the pavement, 25th June
item.description:
This rubbish area which is for the council housing Collent House is overflowing and spilling into the street. This is the council's responsibility - and if it is not dealt with I will be reporting this to our MP

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Collent Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bin bag of rubbish and additional rubbish, 25th June
item.description:
Black bag of rubbish and other rubbish that has been dumped alongside it
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 25th June
item.description:
A tenant has moved out and left three mattresses and a bed as well as emptied there entire flat into communal bins shared between 6 flats. I have sent an email to environmental services. It is at a entrance of a flat and is creating a pungent smell as nappies are included. So we cant open our windows at the front as it looks directly onto this mess. Many thanks. The site is not allowing me to uplaod my pucs however if you provide an email, I will send them over?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenhaven Drive, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dying trees, 25th June
item.description:
New trees planted at Hook Farm end in Norman Park desperately need watering. They are drying up and dying. Apparently there are dying or dead trees also in Kelsey Park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cedars Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Overflowing bin not fit for purpose outside park/school, 25th June
item.description:
This bin is constantly overflowing and it’s not fit for purpose. It’s a hugely busy area by the park and Riverside school so this bin get filled up a lot and literally every other day it’s over flowing with rubbish that gets pulled out by the abundance of wildlife by the river. The bin itself is not fit for purpose, it’s a tiny bin for the amount of rubbish in the area and it’s oval shaped not round so things get wedged in it and make it fuller than it is because you can’t push things down inside it to make the most of the internal space. I don’t think it’s a lot to ask to give us a decent bin outside the park/school that can handle a few days worth of rubbish if you want us to keep the place tidy. NEW DECENT SHAPED/SIZED BIN PLEASE

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contaminated green bin, 25th June
item.description:
Green bin at 18 Tyrwhitt Road is full of garden waste and other non-recyclable rubbish. Please can the bin be emptied so that it can be used for recycling again. The property is used for temporary social housing (by Southwark Council) so the residents are unlikely to fix the issue, even though they want to be able to recycle their rubbish. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Tyrwhitt Road, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large quantity of litter all the way down street, 25th June
item.description:
There's a large quantity of litter incl nappies all the way down the street, has not been cleared for weeks. The drink container near number two has been there for 3w+. I normally clean the street when it's like this but don't have capacity at the moment!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stamford Grove East, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped bed base., 25th June
item.description:
The bed base is blocking the pavement. I'm sure the fact the street is so filthy, with litter that has been here for weeks, makes the street look like a great place to fly-tip.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stamford Grove West, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Caravan being lived in on the street, 25th June
item.description:
A caravan has returned on the side of the road and is being lived in. It was there previously and then left but has now returned. It is unsettling for the local community - what are they doing with their waste, will it attract further caravan dwellers. Can they be moved on?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broad Walk, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed recycling collection. AGAIN, 25th June
item.description:
Recycling was not collected yesterday despite being left out before 6am. All addresses on this part of church street. Last time they didn’t bother to collect until the following week, meaning the rubbish was left on the public pavement all week.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
